patient_info: Renal potassium wasting,Hypokalemia,Increased urinary potassium,Hypocalciuria,Metabolic alkalosis
golden_diagnosis: Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome,Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome,Gitelman 综合征/Gitelman syndrome; GS/Gitelman syndrome/Gitelman syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Gitelman Syndrome
2. Bartter Syndrome
3. Liddle Syndrome
4. Hyperaldosteronism
5. Tubular Transporter Defects (e.g., ROMK mutations)
6. Voltage-gated Potassium Channel Defects
7. Cystic Fibrosis-related Diabetes Mellitus
8. Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease (ADPKD) with tubular dysfunction
9. Renal Tubular Acidosis (RTA) - Distal type
10. Uremic Tubular Necrosis (in the setting of chronic kidney disease)

Each of these conditions can present with a combination of the symptoms listed in the patient's phenotype, particularly renal potassium wasting, hypokalemia, increased urinary potassium, and metabolic alkalosis. It is important to note that further clinical evaluation, laboratory testing, and genetic analysis may be necessary to confirm the diagnosis.
